title: Israel-Gaza conflict could trigger global economic crisis, says World bank chief Ajay Banga
content: World Bank President Ajay Banga warns that the Israel-Gaza conflict's escalation could severely impact the global economy. He highlighted potential risks if the war extends to resource-rich regions. The World Bank has increased its financial support to the Palestinian Authority amid ongoing devastation and calls for broader international intervention to mitigate the crisis.
summary: World Bank President Ajay Banga warns that the Israel-Gaza conflict's escalation could severely impact the global economy. He highlighted potential risks if the war extends to resource-rich regions. The World Bank has increased its financial support to the Palestinian Authority amid ongoing devastation and calls for broader international intervention to mitigate the crisis.

title: 'Govt remains open to ...': What Canada's trade minister said on economic ties with India
content: Canadian trade minister Mary Ng affirmed Canada’s commitment to maintaining strong commercial ties with India despite recent diplomatic tensions. She reassured Canadian businesses of continued government support and emphasized balancing economic interests with the protection of Canadian citizens and adherence to the rule of law.
summary: Canadian trade minister Mary Ng affirmed Canada’s commitment to maintaining strong commercial ties with India despite recent diplomatic tensions. She reassured Canadian businesses of continued government support and emphasized balancing economic interests with the protection of Canadian citizens and adherence to the rule of law.

title: 'She'll cut her own path ...': Biden on Kamala Harris' Presidential vision
content: At a Democratic dinner, President Biden endorsed Kamala Harris for presidency, emphasizing her ability to carve a new path while remaining loyal. Biden contrasted her fresh perspective with Donald Trump's outdated, dishonest views. Harris, who took over Biden's nomination, faces GOP backlash but shows promise as a new leader, according to recent polls.
summary: At a Democratic dinner, President Biden endorsed Kamala Harris for presidency, emphasizing her ability to carve a new path while remaining loyal. Biden contrasted her fresh perspective with Donald Trump's outdated, dishonest views. Harris, who took over Biden's nomination, faces GOP backlash but shows promise as a new leader, according to recent polls.

title: Chinese aquarium criticised for using robot instead of real Whale Shark
content: Xiaomeisha Sea World in Shenzhen faced backlash for showcasing a mechanical whale shark after five years of renovations. Critics highlighted the robot's visible gaps and the high entry fee of $40, expressing disappointment on social media. The aquarium defended the decision, citing laws against trading live whale sharks, but visitors remained dissatisfied.
summary: Xiaomeisha Sea World in Shenzhen faced backlash for showcasing a mechanical whale shark after five years of renovations. Critics highlighted the robot's visible gaps and the high entry fee of $40, expressing disappointment on social media. The aquarium defended the decision, citing laws against trading live whale sharks, but visitors remained dissatisfied.

title: 'No one should go to jail for smoking weed': Harris promises to legalise recreational marijuana
content: Kamala Harris promises to legalize recreational marijuana if elected, emphasizing its disproportionate impact on Black men. She aims to work with Congress to ensure lawful cultivation, distribution, and possession of cannabis, and plans to support Black entrepreneurs through forgivable loans and better regulation.
summary: Kamala Harris promises to legalize recreational marijuana if elected, emphasizing its disproportionate impact on Black men. She aims to work with Congress to ensure lawful cultivation, distribution, and possession of cannabis, and plans to support Black entrepreneurs through forgivable loans and better regulation.

title: 'Possess, control, impregnate her': Olivia Nuzzi's ex-fiancé claims RFK jr manipulated her
content: Ryan Lizza claims Olivia Nuzzi had a toxic affair with RFK Jr., describes him as a sex addict who manipulated her. Nuzzi accuses Lizza of harassment and blackmail after he encouraged her to disclose the affair. Nuzzi, currently on leave, seeks a protective order against Lizza. RFK Jr. denies the accusations.
summary: Ryan Lizza claims Olivia Nuzzi had a toxic affair with RFK Jr., describes him as a sex addict who manipulated her. Nuzzi accuses Lizza of harassment and blackmail after he encouraged her to disclose the affair. Nuzzi, currently on leave, seeks a protective order against Lizza. RFK Jr. denies the accusations.

title: Over 800 US military veterans released under 'don’t ask, don’t tell' policy receive honorable discharges
content: More than 800 military personnel discharged under the “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy have had their service records upgraded to honorable discharges. This initiative, part of a review by defense secretary Lloyd Austin, aims to rectify past discrimination against LGBTQ service members in the US military.
summary: More than 800 military personnel discharged under the “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy have had their service records upgraded to honorable discharges. This initiative, part of a review by defense secretary Lloyd Austin, aims to rectify past discrimination against LGBTQ service members in the US military.

title: UN says Yemen risks being dragged into Mideast conflict that could spiral out of control
Georgia kicks off early voting with record-breaking 2,50,000 ballot casts
content: Georgia sees a record-breaking early voting turnout, with over 252,000 votes cast on the first day, highlighting its battleground status. This surpasses the previous 2020 record of 136,000 votes. Former President Jimmy Carter, aged 100, also participated. New regulations may impact absentee voting, but officials ensure election security and accuracy amidst high voter enthusiasm.
summary: Georgia sees a record-breaking early voting turnout, with over 252,000 votes cast on the first day, highlighting its battleground status. This surpasses the previous 2020 record of 136,000 votes. Former President Jimmy Carter, aged 100, also participated. New regulations may impact absentee voting, but officials ensure election security and accuracy amidst high voter enthusiasm.

title: British Indians most successful ethnic group in UK: report
content: A report by Policy Exchange highlights the Indian community in Britain as the top-performing ethnic group in professions, pay rates, home ownership, and social integration. Despite high achievements, social class, rather than race, remains the key barrier to success. The rise of 'minorities in towns' is led by aspirational British Indians, shaping future electoral battlegrounds.
summary: A report by Policy Exchange highlights the Indian community in Britain as the top-performing ethnic group in professions, pay rates, home ownership, and social integration. Despite high achievements, social class, rather than race, remains the key barrier to success. The rise of 'minorities in towns' is led by aspirational British Indians, shaping future electoral battlegrounds.

title: Donald Trump clashes with Bloomberg editor over tariff: 'Must be hard for you...'
content: Trump said higher tariffs would make it more likely for foreign companies to build factories in the United States. "I was always very good at Mathematics," Trump said as he added that he's all about growth and will bring companies to the country. He also said that tariff is his favorite word in the dictionary.
summary: Trump said higher tariffs would make it more likely for foreign companies to build factories in the United States. "I was always very good at Mathematics," Trump said as he added that he's all about growth and will bring companies to the country. He also said that tariff is his favorite word in the dictionary.

title: Harris vs Trump is now 50/50 in Nate Silver's latest prediction
content: Nate Silver's latest forecast indicates a 50/50 race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, while the NBC latest poll also shows both candidates at 48% support. Movement towards Trump in key states has tightened the contest. The campaign heats up with Harris questioning Trump's fitness report and Trump cancelling another mainstream press interview.
summary: Nate Silver's latest forecast indicates a 50/50 race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, while the NBC latest poll also shows both candidates at 48% support. Movement towards Trump in key states has tightened the contest. The campaign heats up with Harris questioning Trump's fitness report and Trump cancelling another mainstream press interview.

title: Lufthansa fined $4 million for blocking 128 Jewish passengers in 2022
content: German airline Lufthansa faced a $4 million fine by the US government for denying boarding to 128 Orthodox Jewish passengers in 2022, citing alleged misbehavior. Lufthansa apologized, denying any discrimination, and has since partnered with the American Jewish Committee to develop an anti-discrimination training program for their staff. Lufthansa agreed to pay $2 million and the Department of Transportation said it will credit the airline with $2 million that it paid in compensation to passengers.
summary: German airline Lufthansa faced a $4 million fine by the US government for denying boarding to 128 Orthodox Jewish passengers in 2022, citing alleged misbehavior. Lufthansa apologized, denying any discrimination, and has since partnered with the American Jewish Committee to develop an anti-discrimination training program for their staff. Lufthansa agreed to pay $2 million and the Department of Transportation said it will credit the airline with $2 million that it paid in compensation to passengers.

title: Did Trump dance for 30 minutes? Or was he 'lost, confused, frozen'? Here's what happened
content: As the video of Donald Trump standing on the stage doing nothing went viral, Trump supporters claimed that the Kamala Harris campaign doctored the video as desperate measures while Trump actually decided to play music for the town hall after there were two medical emergencies. The medical emergencies that took place to some audience members came as lengthy interruptions to Donald Trump's townhall and so the former president opted to play several of his favorite songs to the crowd.
summary: As the video of Donald Trump standing on the stage doing nothing went viral, Trump supporters claimed that the Kamala Harris campaign doctored the video as desperate measures while Trump actually decided to play music for the town hall after there were two medical emergencies. The medical emergencies that took place to some audience members came as lengthy interruptions to Donald Trump's townhall and so the former president opted to play several of his favorite songs to the crowd.

title: Cushions, carpet, no negative comments: List of Meghan, Harry's bizarre demands for 2021 school visit revealed
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle visited a low-income school in New York for their Netflix documentary and made several unusual requests like new carpets and cushions for Meghan's aesthetic. Their team sought extensive control over media and consent forms to avoid any negative remarks. Only 'Meghan-friendly' publications were allowed to cover the visit.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle visited a low-income school in New York for their Netflix documentary and made several unusual requests like new carpets and cushions for Meghan's aesthetic. Their team sought extensive control over media and consent forms to avoid any negative remarks. Only 'Meghan-friendly' publications were allowed to cover the visit.

title: No one was sick but Delta cancels meal services on 200 flights over 'safety issue'
content: Delta Airlines halted in-flight meal services on over 200 flights from Detroit Metro Airport after an FDA inspection found a food safety issue at its catering partner's kitchen. Though no illnesses were reported, the airline is revising food preparation methods and used alternative meal options and compensations for affected passengers. “Delta and its catering partner immediately shut down hot food production and subsequently suspended all activity from the facility,” the airline said in a statement.
summary: Delta Airlines halted in-flight meal services on over 200 flights from Detroit Metro Airport after an FDA inspection found a food safety issue at its catering partner's kitchen. Though no illnesses were reported, the airline is revising food preparation methods and used alternative meal options and compensations for affected passengers. “Delta and its catering partner immediately shut down hot food production and subsequently suspended all activity from the facility,” the airline said in a statement.

title: Trump reveals Barron loves Bussin' with the Boys podcast, 'He told me you got to...'
content: Former president Donald Trump made an appearance at the football show Bussin' With The Boys with Will Compton and Taylor Lewan and as he congratulated the show, he revealed that his son loves them. "My son said dad, you got to do those with them. Those guys are great. You know I have a son of 6'9''. How tall are you?" Donald Trump asked the hosts. Taylor Lewan said he is 6.7. Then Donald Trump told how good Barron Trump is at his studies etc.
summary: Former president Donald Trump made an appearance at the football show Bussin' With The Boys with Will Compton and Taylor Lewan and as he congratulated the show, he revealed that his son loves them. "My son said dad, you got to do those with them. Those guys are great. You know I have a son of 6'9''. How tall are you?" Donald Trump asked the hosts. Taylor Lewan said he is 6.7. Then Donald Trump told how good Barron Trump is at his studies etc.

title: Startling report says Israeli forces used Palestinian detainees as human shields in booby-traps
content: A New York Times report alleges that Israeli soldiers and intelligence agents used captured Palestinians as human shields in Gaza during the conflict against Hamas. Despite the Israel Defense Forces denying these claims, the investigation revealed that detainees were forced into dangerous reconnaissance missions, an act prohibited under Israeli and international law. The practice was reportedly routine, with involvement from senior intelligence officers.
summary: A New York Times report alleges that Israeli soldiers and intelligence agents used captured Palestinians as human shields in Gaza during the conflict against Hamas. Despite the Israel Defense Forces denying these claims, the investigation revealed that detainees were forced into dangerous reconnaissance missions, an act prohibited under Israeli and international law. The practice was reportedly routine, with involvement from senior intelligence officers.

title: Imran Khan kept in dark cell, isolated; no weekly calls to sons: Ex-wife Jemima
content: Jemima said she had come to know that the authorities are torturing Imran Khan by completely isolating him. "We have received reports that the authorities have now turned off the lights and electricity in his cell and he is no longer allowed to leave his cell at any time. The jail cook has been sent on leave. He is now completely isolated, in solitary confinement, literally in the dark, with no contact with the outside world. His lawyers are concerned about his safety and well-being," Jemima wrote.
summary: Jemima said she had come to know that the authorities are torturing Imran Khan by completely isolating him. "We have received reports that the authorities have now turned off the lights and electricity in his cell and he is no longer allowed to leave his cell at any time. The jail cook has been sent on leave. He is now completely isolated, in solitary confinement, literally in the dark, with no contact with the outside world. His lawyers are concerned about his safety and well-being," Jemima wrote.

title: Watch: Donald Trump forgets election day? 'If everybody votes on January 5'
content: “If everything works out, if everybody gets out and votes on January 5th or before. You know, it used to be, you'd have a date. Today you can vote two months before, probably three months after, they don't know what the hell they're doing. But we’re gonna straighten it all out. We’re gonna straighten that out, too. We’re gonna straighten out our election process, too," Trump said at Pennsylvania. “He mixed up his coup date and the election date,” an X user wrote.
summary: “If everything works out, if everybody gets out and votes on January 5th or before. You know, it used to be, you'd have a date. Today you can vote two months before, probably three months after, they don't know what the hell they're doing. But we’re gonna straighten it all out. We’re gonna straighten that out, too. We’re gonna straighten out our election process, too," Trump said at Pennsylvania. “He mixed up his coup date and the election date,” an X user wrote.
